title: E0597 sometimes appears instead of E0373 in cases where the solution is to add `move`

labels.name: A-diagnostics

body:
This caused me a lot of grief when I was first learning Rust a few years ago, and now a friend is learning the language and has run into the same problem.

In my case, I had learned about `move` earlier, but it hadn't stuck with me because I hadn't understood closures' relationship with borrowing. In their case, they hadn't learned about `move` at all yet. In both cases, it took hours before we asked for help and learned that the solution was locked behind a keyword.

I've included one case that can be replicated in the playground, but fixing this one likely won't fix them all. This has happened before: #54284

```rust
fn closure(x: u32) -> impl Fn() -> u32 {
    || x
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=5eddfe582b8a5bb96427384e161d0e8f))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0597]: `x` does not live long enough
 --> src/lib.rs:2:8
  |
1 | fn closure(x: u32) -> impl Fn() -> u32 {
  |                       ---------------- opaque type requires that `x` is borrowed for `'static`
2 |     || x
  |     -- ^ borrowed value does not live long enough
  |     |
  |     value captured here
3 | }
  |  - `x` dropped here while still borrowed
  |
help: you can add a bound to the opaque type to make it last less than `'static` and match `'static`
  |
1 | fn closure(x: u32) -> impl Fn() -> u32 + 'static {
  |                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0597`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
